articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Indian Ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Indian Ambassador
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with Pratap Singh, Indian ambassador to the DPRK, when he paid a farewell visit to him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Thursday.

articles.title: Congratulations to Libyan PM
articles.content:
Congratulations to Libyan PM
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim in a message on Wednesday congratulated Mustafa Abu Shagur on his election as prime minister of Libya.
					 Choe in the message expressed conviction that the bonds of friendship and cooperation between the peoples of the two countries would continue to favorably develop.
					
					 He wished the prime minister success in his responsible work for the country's peace, security and rehabilitation.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Major Enterprises
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Major Enterprises
						
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- Premier Choe Yong Rim, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, made a field survey of the Hungnam Fertilizer Complex and the February 8 Vinalon Complex.
					 The premier convened consultative meetings after looking round various places of the above-said complexes.
					
					 They referred to the need for officials and workers to boost the production of fertilizers for socialist rural areas.
					
					 They also took measures to increase production by improving the management of equipment and technical control at the production processes including the process of vinalon fiber. Measures were also taken for relevant units to supply necessary resources and materials.
					
					 He said that enterprises play very important roles in building an economic power and improving the people's standard of living, calling on the workers to take the lead in the on-going advance for great surge.
					
					 Earlier, he went round the Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex and convened a consultative meeting.
					
					 The meeting discussed measures to increase the production of iron and steel by directing sustained big efforts to the modernization of the production processes and provide coal and electricity to the enterprise on a priority basis.

articles.title: Condolences to Kim Jong Un from President of Maldives
articles.content:
Condolences to Kim Jong Un from President of Maldives
						
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a condolence message on Sept. 5 from President of Maldives Mohammed Waheed Hassan.
					 The message said the president received very sad news that the typhoon that hit the DPRK left lots of people dead and wounded.
					
					 It is an irretrievable damage and a great sadness that thousands of houses, farmland and infrastructure were washed away and destroyed, the message said.
					
					 The president in the message extended profound condolences to Kim Jong Un and the government and people of the DPRK on behalf of the government and people of Maldives.
					
					 He wished for success in the work for recovering from the damage by the dogged fighting spirit and positive efforts of the people of the DPRK.
					
					 He expressed his sincere consolation to the bereaved families.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from President of Mozambique
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from President of Mozambique
						
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a congratulatory message from Armando Emilio Guebuza, president of the Republic of Mozambique, on August 22.
					 The president extended his warm felicitations and greetings to the supreme leader Kim Jong Un and the people of the DPRK with great joy on the occasion of the 64th anniversary of the DPRK.
					
					 He wished Kim Jong Un good health and the friendly people of the DPRK progress and prosperity, sending his highest regards to him.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Algerian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Algerian President
						
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a congratulatory message from Algerian President Abdelaziz Bouteflika on Sept. 13.
					 The president in his message extended warm congratulations to Kim Jong Un on behalf of the Algerian people and government and on his own behalf on the occasion of the 64th anniversary of the DPRK. He was pleased to wish Kim Jong Un good health and happiness and the friendly Korean people progress and prosperity, the message said.
					
					 Availing himself of the opportunity, he reiterated his will to make continued efforts with Kim Jong Un to steadily boost the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries and peoples.
					
					 He sent the best regards to Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Congratulations to Kim Jong Un from President of Tunisia
articles.content:
Congratulations to Kim Jong Un from President of Tunisia
						
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a congratulatory message from Al Moncef Al Marzouki, president of the Republic of Tunisia, on September 10.
					 The president in the message extended the sincerest congratulations to Kim Jong Un, wishing him good health and happiness and the friendly people of the DPRK greater progress and prosperity on the occasion of the anniversary of the DPRK.
					
					 Availing himself of the happy opportunity, he expressed his conviction that he would make his efforts to steadily develop the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries in the interests of the two peoples.

articles.title: Spokesman for DPRK FM Accuses U.S. of Its Move to Build New Radar Base in Japan
articles.content:
Spokesman for DPRK FM Accuses U.S. of Its Move to Build New Radar Base in Japan
						
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the DPRK foreign ministry gave the following answer to a question put by KCNA on Thursday as regards the U.S. announcement of a plan to build a new radar base in Japan to cope with the "DPRK's threat of missile attack":
					 U.S. Defense Secretary Panetta met on Monday his Japanese counterpart in Tokyo and held a joint press conference at which they announced they agreed to build another radar base in the southern part of Japan to cope with "north Korea's threat of missile attack."
					
					 Disclosed earlier was a plan worked out by the U.S. and Japan to build a missile shield in Asia by building a new radar base in Southeast Asia and link it with the missile interceptor systems deployed on the ground and in waters.
					
					 The U.S. decision to build the radar base in Japan is obviously targeting big countries in Eurasia as part of its moves to round off the regional missile defense system. This will only strain the regional situation and escalate the arms race.
					
					 Over the last decades the U.S. has steadily increased the military spending by misleading the public opinion with a trite psychological warfare that it is building a missile shield against the potential enemies' missile strikes. By doing so, it has brought big profits to the munitions monopolies and, at the same time, worked hard to establish the system of its military domination in various parts of the world.
					
					  In fact, it is impossible to intercept something with a missile shield.
					
					 What should not be overlooked is that Panetta openly declared the new radar is targeted against the DPRK, not China.
					
					 The U.S. military chief disclosed the plan at a time when the U.S. diplomatic chief lost no chance to let loose rhetoric that the U.S. has no hostile intent on the DPRK. This is tantamount to the U.S. total denial of its words and open admission of its hostility towards the DPRK.
					
					 Given the fact that the U.S., the world's biggest possessor of nukes and missiles, is stepping up its arms build-up against the DPRK, it is quite natural for it to steadily bolster up its nuclear deterrent.
					
					 The U.S. attitude requires the DPRK to become a more powerful nuclear weapons state as befitting the "rival" of the U.S.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime Slammed for Pushing Forward Construction of Naval Base on Jeju Island
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime Slammed for Pushing Forward Construction of Naval Base on Jeju Island 
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Korea Asia-Pacific Peace Committee issued the following statement Thursday:
					 The south Korean puppet regime's stepped-up construction of a big naval base on Jeju Island has drawn a flurry of censure and protest from broad south Koreans.
					
					 The addition of the capacity for the passage of nuclear carriers at the request of the American master has further enraged the people.
					
					 The broad range of south Koreans are demanding an immediate stop to the naval base construction, saying that "it is like getting embroiled in the competition of big powers for hegemony" and "getting a time-bomb". Environmental protection organizations submitted to the plenary meeting of the International Union for Conservation of Nature held on the island recently a resolution calling for the stop to the construction.
					
					 Upset by this, the south Korean regime is claiming that the construction is aimed to accommodate big vessels to meet the trend and it is environment-friendly. It has given a continued push to the construction, citing "security".
					
					 The construction is a very dangerous act of treachery aimed to make the island a bridgehead for realizing the U.S. ambition for world domination and carrying out its strategy of attaching importance to the Asia-Pacific, and turn it into an advance post for a nuclear war.
					
					 If the capacity for the passage of the U.S. carriers is created in the base, it will naturally mount military tension on the Korean Peninsula and the rest of Northeast Asia and increase the danger of a nuclear war.
					
					 The push given by the regime to the naval base project despite the protest of south Koreans is prompted by its aim to bolster military nexus pursuant to the U.S. strategy of attaching importance to the Asia-Pacific and keep up the project even after new "regime" takes over power.
					
					 Lurking behind the move is also an aim to garner supporting votes for the military and the pro-U.S. conservative forces in the upcoming "presidential" election.
					
					 There are lots of U.S. nuclear bases in south Korea. But traitor Lee Myung Bak and the "Saenuri Party" clan are offering even Jeju Island, tourists' attraction, to their master as a nuclear outpost. Such hideous pro-U.S. traitors and despicable war servants will never be found in any other part of the world.
					
					  Lee and military warmongers are portraying the naval base as a civilian-army combined base but it is just sophism to evade public criticism.
					
					 Absolutely intolerable are their moves to turn the island into a nuclear outpost of the U.S. under its manipulation.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will never remain an on-looker to their moves to inflict a nuclear holocaust on the nation in alignment with outsiders but take stronger countermeasures for self-defence.
					
					 The south Koreans should turn out in actions against the naval base project and wipe out the die-hard pro-U.S. traitors from this land at an early date.

articles.title: Floral Basket Laid before Equestrian Statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Basket Laid before Equestrian Statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il 
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- The participants in the 13th Pyongyang International Film Festival laid a floral basket before the equestrian statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il at the Mansudae Art Studio on Thursday.
					 They paid tribute after laying a floral basket and bouquets before the statues in deep reverence for the peerlessly great men who contributed to the development of Juche-based cinematic arts and  global independence.

articles.title: DPRK Delegation to 67th UN General Assembly Session Leaves
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation to 67th UN General Assembly Session Leaves
						
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- The DPRK delegation headed by Vice Foreign Minister Pak Kil Yon left here on Thursday to take part in the 67th UN General Assembly session.

articles.title: Turkish Political Party Delegation Arrives
articles.content:
Turkish Political Party Delegation Arrives
						
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Workers' Party of Turkey headed by Dasar Karadag, member of the Political Bureau of its Central Committee, arrived here on Thursday.

articles.title: Many Visitors Pay Tribute to Kim Jong Suk's Bust
articles.content:
Many Visitors Pay Tribute to Kim Jong Suk's Bust
						
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- The number of visitors to the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong is increasing these days in the run-up to the death anniversary of Kim Jong Suk, anti-Japanese war hero. They include Koreans, overseas Koreans and foreigners.
					 More than 450 000 people of at least 4 200 organizations visited the bust of Kim Jong Suk at the cemetery as of now this year to pay tribute to her.
					
					 Service personnel, people from all walks of life, school youth and children visited her bust on the Day of the Sun, the Day of the Shining Star and other holidays.
					
					 Among the visitors were delegates to the Fourth Conference of the Workers' Party of Korea, the meeting of activists of the general mobilization movement for land management and the celebrations of the 66th anniversary of the Korean Children's Union and the Youth Day.
					
					 Also among them were service personnel of the Korean People's Army and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces, working people of ministries, national institutions, central and local organs, enterprises, factories, cooperative farms, schools at all levels and school youth and children.
					
					 Overseas Koreans and foreigners are also visiting the cemetery.
					
					 Delegations and home-visiting groups of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan and other overseas Koreans, members of a delegation of the Chinese People's Association for Peace and Disarmament and a delegation of the Central Committee of the Fatherland Front of Vietnam and other foreigners laid bouquets before her bust before paying respects.

articles.title: National Seminar on Kim Jong Il's Patriotism Held
articles.content:
National Seminar on Kim Jong Il's Patriotism Held
						
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- A national seminar was held at the People's Palace of Culture here on Thursday to deeply grasp Kim Jong Il's patriotism and embody it thoroughly in practice.
					 Present there were Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, officials concerned, officials of party and administrative organs and working people's organizations and those in the fields of science, education, literature and arts, media, party cadre training and the preservation of revolutionary sites.
					
					 It discussed tasks facing all officials, party members and working people to fully embody Kim Jong Il's patriotism and step up the building of a rich and powerful nation, regarding it as a maxim in their life and struggle.
					
					 The speakers said the whole life of leader Kim Jong Il was a history of ardent patriotic devotion in which he covered the path of defending the country despite all hardships and a history of his total dedication to the grandeur and prosperity of Kim Il Sung's Korea.
					
					 Kim Jong Il's patriotism is the acme of socialist patriotism as it was ardent thoughts and feelings with which he set an example in practice for the country and people all his life, they pointed out.
					
					 They praised Kim Jong Il as a peerless patriot who dedicated all his life to the prosperity of the country and the happiness of the younger generation with an ardent and noble outlook on the motherland, people and the youngsters.
					
					 The dear respected Kim Jong Un has personified Kim Jong Il's love for the country and its people on the highest level, they noted, and went on:
					
					 Kim Jong Un nurtured such genuine patriotism as taking warm care of every tree and every blade of grass of the country from his childhood. 
					
					 He is devoting himself to the prosperity of the country and happiness of its people, deeply aware of the high awareness that he is responsible for the destiny of the country and its people whom Kim Jong Il entrusted to him.
					
					 It is a bounden duty and sacred task of the descendents of President Kim Il Sung and the soldiers and disciples of Kim Jong Il to make a hot wind of Kim Jong Il's patriotism sweep throughout society and achieve a final victory in the drive for building a thriving nation.
					
					 They called upon all the officials, party members and working people to effect Kim Jong Il's patriotism to the full, regarding it as guidelines for building a thriving nation.

articles.title: 13th Pyongyang International Film Festival Opens
articles.content:
13th Pyongyang International Film Festival Opens
						
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- The 13th Pyongyang International Film Festival (PIFF) opened with due ceremony.
					 The festival will be held divided into long feature films, documentaries, short films, special and information screenings.
					
					 More than 90 films presented by at least 50 units of 30 odd countries will be shown in the festival. 
					
					 The opening ceremony took place at the East Pyongyang Grand Theatre on Thursday. 
					
					 Present at the opening ceremony were Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Vice Premier Kim Yong Jin, Minister of Culture Hong Kwang Sun, chairman of the organizing committee of the festival, Cha Hui Rim, chairman of the Pyongyang City People's Committee, and others, foreign delegations and delegates and international judges.
					
					 The invitees were diplomatic envoys and staff members of foreign embassies and members of missions of international organizations here.
					
					 A video was shown to introduce the films presented to the festival.
					
					 Hong Kwang Sun in an inaugural speech expressed belief that the PIFF that has constantly developed in the idea of independence, peace and friendship would be held successfully amid the positive and sincere support and assistance of the participants.
					
					 Daniel Otto, delegate of Germany, said in a congratulatory speech the festival has been opened successfully thanks to the deep attention of the dear respected Kim Jong Un, the Workers' Party of Korea and the government of the DPRK. 
					
					 The international judges were introduced there.
					
					 The organizing committee of the festival gave a reception for the participants at Okryu Restaurant that day.

articles.title: National Korean Dress Exhibition under Way in Pyongyang
articles.content:
National Korean Dress Exhibition under Way in Pyongyang
						
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- The 10th national Korean dress exhibition is now under way at the Central Youth Hall here.
					 More than 400 seasonal clothes, including coats, suits and shirts, are put on display at the exhibition, besides Korean dresses.
					
					 In particular, women's overcoats presented by a tailor's in Taedonggang District, attract eyes of visitors.
					
					 Colorful styles of men's and women's suits are also on display at the exhibition.
					
					 Conspicuous among them are the suites exhibited by tailor's shops in Central and Moranbong districts, designed for different ages.
					
					 Various styles of dresses and shirts by the Unha Guidance Bureau win high appreciation from visitors.

articles.title: Skating Coaching Course Held in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Skating Coaching Course Held in Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- An Olympic solidarity coaching course for short-track speed skating took place here from Sept. 12 to 19.
					 Attending it, divided into theoretical and practical sections, were coaches of sports teams and teachers of juvenile sports schools in the country.
					
					 The course dealt with such matters as the current trend of technical development in the short-track speed skating event and the training means and methods for physical buildup and technical development of skaters.

articles.title: Capital City Landscaped with Quick Hedges
articles.content:
Capital City Landscaped with Quick Hedges
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- Quick hedges have appeared in all parts of the capital city of Pyongyang, adding to the landscape of the city.
					 Each district of the city has cultivated good species of saplings in its nursery to provide plants needed for hedges.
					
					 Quick hedges are made of shrubs or high trees in parks, pleasure grounds, gardens, green belts, compounds of institutions and residential quarters.
					
					 They are wall-shaped, block-shaped, pillar-shaped and tier-shaped.
					
					 Yang Chol Ho, chief engineer of the Horticultural Management Bureau under the Pyongyang City People's Committee, told KCNA:
					
					 "Hedging in the capital city will be finished by next September, thanks to the citizens' patriotic, devoted efforts for the prosperity of the country."

articles.title: Traditional Dishes Taken by Koreans in Autumn
articles.content:
Traditional Dishes Taken by Koreans in Autumn
						
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- In Korea September belongs to autumn in four seasons.
					 Koreans have a custom of cooking traditional dishes with grain and fruits harvested in the season.
					
					 Half-moon-shaped rice cake, made of new rice, chestnuts and beans, is one of typical traditional dishes in early autumn.
					
					 Jong Sun Hui, a woman living in Taedonggang District, Pyongyang, told KCNA:
					
					 "I learnt from my mother about how to cook rice cake. My family members like it very much."
					
					 Among the dishes is a dumpling made of steamed glutinous rice flour and boiled and grinded chestnut and honey.
					
					 Pyongyang natives used to make pancake with glutinous rice or millet flour, mixed with malt.
					
					 Koreans brew liquor with chrysanthemum in the season.
					
					 Kye Hye Rim, an old woman living in Rangnang District, Pyongyang, said:
					
					 "My family has brewed liquor with chrysanthemum through generations.
					
					 Its flowers and stems mixed with millet are fermented for at least one year. This liquor is very good for health
					
					 I taught my daughter and daughter-in-law how to brew the liquor."
					
					 The traditional autumn dishes, made mainly of materials available in the season, are preserved in the country, steadily enjoying popularity among local people.

articles.title: Japanese Imperialists' History of Aggression against Korea under Fire
articles.content:
Japanese Imperialists' History of Aggression against Korea under Fire
						
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- The Japanese reactionaries are now making desperate efforts to justify their brigandish aggression against Korea in the past. They are, however, sadly mistaken if they think they can dodge the responsibility for their past crimes. Rodong Sinmun Thursday observes this in a bylined article.
					 The Japanese imperialists cooked up the "Unyo-maru" incident, talking about the "Theory of Conquest of Korea" more than a century back. This was a curtain-raiser to the Japanese imperialists' military occupation of Korea and their harsh repressive colonial rule over it.
					
					 Japanese aggressors aboard the vessel "Unyo-maru" illegally intruded into waters off Kanghwa Island on Sept. 19, 1875 to spy on waterway and others in the area of Wolmi Island. The next day they intruded into the Chojijin battery, major military fortress in the West Sea of Korea and stronghold to defend Seoul. Members of the Korean garrison defending the battery showered a barrage of fire on the Japanese aggressors. As if they had been waiting for the opportunity, they conducted saturation shelling at the Chojijin battery and attacked Hangsan and Yongjong islets which were weak in defence, killing many innocent civilians and committing barbarous destruction and plunder.
					
					 Groundlessly asserting that "the Korean side perpetrated a hostile act against Japan", the Japanese invaders again intruded into Kanghwa Island in January of 1876, pressurizing Korea to conclude an unequal treaty with Japan. They finally fabricated the illegal and invalid "Kanghwa Island Treaty" on February 27, 1876, openly threatening and blackmailing Korea with artillery pieces and warships.
					
					 They succeeded in intervening in different domains of Korea including politics, economy and culture on the strength of the treaty.
					
					 Keeping Korea under their military occupation for more than four decades, the Japanese imperialists enforced an unprecedentedly harsh colonial rule over Korea, imposing unspeakable misfortune, sufferings and disasters upon the Korean people.
					
					 Japan should pay a dear price for all the crimes committed by the Japanese imperialists against the Korean people during their nearly half a century-long illegal occupation of Korea, urges the article.
					
					 Minju Joson in a bylined article refers to the "Unyo-maru" incident. The Korean people are filled with the determination to force Japan to pay a thousand-fold dearer price for the crimes committed by the Japanese imperialists against the Korean nation no matter how frequently the old generation is replaced by a new one, notes the paper.

articles.title: Minju Joson Raps Park Geun Hye's Remarks Inciting Confrontation with Countrymen
articles.content:
Minju Joson Raps Park Geun Hye's Remarks Inciting Confrontation with Countrymen
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- Park Geun Hye, presidential candidate from the "Saenuri Party" of south Korea, recently spelled out "an evolving policy towards the north," talking about "stable south-north relations and sustainable peace."
					 She did not clarify what the "evolving policy towards the north" means but cried out for "north's dismantlement of nuclear weapons" and "choice of a new way".
					
					 Minju Joson Thursday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 This goes to prove that what she touted is nothing but rhetoric aimed at leading the north to "dismantlement of nukes, reform and opening".
					
					 Park has sold off the country and the nation, kowtowing to the U.S. It is ridiculous, indeed, for her to dare call on the north to "choose a new way."
					
					 The above-said policy craftily touted by her indicates that she is seeking a way for realizing her bid to come to power in confrontation with fellow fellowmen. 
					
					 This confrontation is little short of committing a suicide. None of those who went crazy for confrontation with compatriots could escape their doom.
					
					 It is needless to say that such type traitor's coming to power would only lay hurdles in the way of the north-south relations and national reunification.
					
					 The DPRK will never pardon anyone pulling it up.

articles.title: Korean in U.S. Terms S. Korea Tundra of Human Rights
articles.content:
Korean in U.S. Terms S. Korea Tundra of Human Rights 
						
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- Member of the Federation of Koreans in U.S. Ri Jun Mu posted an article titled "Alarm Sounded for Human Rights in South Korea" on the internet on September 12.
					 The article said south Korea tops the suicide rate in the world.
					
					 To make matters worse, high-profile crimes have become rife in society, throwing people into uneasiness. it said, adding:
					
					 Not a day passes without sexual abuses against little girls and such horrible criminal cases in which passers-by are lured and abducted before sexually assaulted and killed and their bodies are secretly buried.
					
					 Nevertheless, the south Korean conservative authorities declared they would kick up a noisy conspiratorial "human right" racket against the north with the International Pen Conference slated to take place in Seoul as a momentum. This is a blatant challenge to the north which has pursued the most popular policy in the world.
					
					 A sexual abuse broke out in Thongyong of South Kyongsang Province less than a month since the latest case of sexual assault. This clearly indicates the real picture of south Korean society where Yankee style corrupt culture prevails and the people are under the conservative forces' misrule.
					
					 Mothers are staging candlelight demonstrations with tears in their  eyes despite heavy rain, demanding a severe punishment of criminals. They are, at the same time, condemning the conservative authorities for their incompetence.
					
					 According to information recently released by the south Korean police agency, 82 000 sexual assaults broke out for five years from 2007 to the previous year, but criminals are still at large in most cases.
					
					 The victims' parents are bitterly angered at the conservative ruling forces who are only trumpeting about the "human rights in the north" instead of trying hard to settle their human right issues though they have reduced south Korea to a huge cemetery of human rights.
					
					 Beside the above-said problems, there are countless human rights issues pending urgent solutions.
					
					 The issue of workers, industrial disaster, discrimination against women, school registration fees and human right abuses committed by the U.S. forces in south Korea, etc. remain unresolved, far from being put on agenda.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Carried by Nepalese Paper
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Carried by Nepalese Paper
						
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- The full text of the dear respected Kim Jong Un's work "Only Victory and Glory Are in Store for Us Advancing under the Uplifted Immortal Banners Bearing Portraits of Smiling Great Comrades Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il" was carried by the Nepalese paper Arpan on Sept. 14.
					 This speech made by Kim Jong Un at the banquet given in celebration of August 25, 2012 clarifies the Songun feats of Generalissimo Kim Jong Il.
					
					 It calls for making a dynamic struggle to achieve the final victory of the revolutionary cause of Juche and Songun pioneered by Generalissimo Kim Il Sung and led to victory by Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: News of Kim Jong Un's Field Guidance Given Publicity Abroad
articles.content:
News of Kim Jong Un's Field Guidance Given Publicity Abroad
						
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- News of the dear respected Kim Jong Un's field guidance were given publicity by media of various countries and a regional organization between September 1 and 14.
					 The internet paper Hanber Journal and an internet magazine of Russia introduced with photos the news that Kim Jong Un went round the e-library newly arranged in the Museum of Arms and Equipment of the Korean People's Army and the Pyongyang Folk Park and the Physical Exercise Center in Thongil Street nearing their completion.
					
					 The paper gave a detailed account of the fact that he gave field guidance to Haemaji Restaurant before opening to service and the Taedonggang Tile Factory built on an expansion basis and visited working people's families who moved to new flats in Changjon Street.
					
					 The Nepalese paper Arpan carried the news that he provided field guidance to the Taedonggang Tile Factory built on an expansion basis.
					
					 The News Agency of Laos reported in detail that the Supreme Commander of the KPA went round the Pyongyang Folk Park nearing its completion, visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun and enjoyed a performance given by the KPA Song and Dance Ensemble on the occasion of the 64th anniversary of the DPRK.
					
					 The International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions in its Internet homepage highlighted photo-accompanied news that he went round the newly built e-library in the Museum of Arms and Equipment of the KPA and gave field guidance to the Taedonggang Tile Factory built on an expansion basis.

articles.title: DPRK's Birthday Marked by Foreign Papers
articles.content:
DPRK's Birthday Marked by Foreign Papers 
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- Foreign newspapers devoted articles to the 64th anniversary of the DPRK. 
					 The Uruguayan newspaper La Juventud on Sept. 6 carried an article titled "Socialist Korea, People's Country," saying that the DPRK is a people's country in name and reality. 
					
					 It praised exploits President Kim Il Sung performed by building a genuine people's power representing and protecting the interests of the working people. 
					
					 It went on:
					
					 New appearance of Pyongyang befitting the dignity of the prospering DPRK is the fruition of the love shown by leader Kim Jong Il and the dear respected Kim Jong Un for the people through their patriotic devotion. 
					
					 The DPRK, the people's country, will eternally prosper thanks to the absolute support and trust of the working masses. 
					
					 The Egyptian paper Al Misaiya on Sept. 6 ran an article titled "Power of Korea" saying that the DPRK is not a big country in its territory and population, but it has matchless strength as no one dares provoke. This is because the DPRK has the outstanding leaders. 
					
					 The Indian paper Tourism Era on Sept. 5 carried an article "Toward the eminence of a thriving nation" introducing the DPRK achieving marvelous successes in building an economic power while strengthening the position of politico-ideological power and military power. 
					
					 The Mexican paper Unidad Nacional on Aug. 30 in an article titled "Founder of the DPRK" highly praised the exploits performed by Kim Il Sung in the nation-building. 
					
					 The 33rd issue of the Russian paper Veteran carried an article praising exploits performed by the President in the nation-building.

articles.title: DPRK's Principled Stand Reported Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK's Principled Stand Reported Abroad
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- Foreign mass media reported the principled stand of the DPRK as regards the evermore intensified hostile actions of the U.S. and its followers against the DPRK from Sept. 10 to 14. 
					 The Rostov-Na-Donu Anti-Bourgeois Front of Russia posted on its internet website the answer given by a spokesman for the DPRK Foreign Ministry to the question put by KCNA under the title "The DPRK has become a full-fledged nuclear weapons state to cope with the U.S. persistent hostile policy". 
					
					 The Nepali newspaper Arpan, conveying this news, carried a statement issued by a spokesman for the DPRK Foreign Ministry which disclosed the illegality of the U.S. military presence in south Korea under the title "U.S. military presence in south Korea is a vivid expression of the U.S. hostile policy towards the DPRK". 
					
					 The Brazilian newspaper Hora do Povo also carried the statement of the spokesman for the DPRK Foreign Ministry.

articles.title: Chinese FM Spokesman Urges Japan Not to Evade Its Responsibility
articles.content:
Chinese FM Spokesman Urges Japan Not to Evade Its Responsibility 
						
 Beijing, September 19 (KCNA) -- Hong Lei, a spokesman for the Chinese Foreign Ministry, in a press conference on Sept. 17 rejected the sordid attempt of Japan over the issue of Diaoyu Islands.
					 Recalling that the Japanese prime minister on Sept. 16 said Japan could not help being disappointed at the ceaseless anti-Japanese demonstrations in China and urged the Chinese government to take what he called steps against them, the spokesman stressed Japan should not evade or conceal its responsibility.
					
					 The Chinese government had already expressed its stand in various forms on the illegal "purchase of islands" by the Japanese government, and the Chinese people, too, are expressing strong resentment at this, Hong noted.
					
					 The issue of whether Japan will solemnly approach the stand of the Chinese government and the just voices of the Chinese people or not and Japan's right attitude and action affect the developments, he warned.

articles.title: All-China Federation of Trade Unions Condemns Japan's Unilateral Moves to Expand Its Territory
articles.content:
All-China Federation of Trade Unions Condemns Japan's Unilateral Moves to Expand Its Territory
 Beijing, September 19 (KCNA) -- The All-China Federation of Trade Unions recently issued a statement condemning Japan's unilateral action concerning Diaoyu Islands.
					 The statement accused Japan of "purchasing" Diaoyu Islands and islets around them and declaring the "nationalization" of them despite China's opposition. All the working people of China are strongly opposed to any action of Japan violating the country's sovereignty, it noted, and continued:
					
					 They will firmly support all steps taken by the government for protecting the state sovereignty.

articles.title: U.S., Japan to Establish New MD in Japan
articles.content:
U.S., Japan to Establish New MD in Japan
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- The U.S. and Japan are aligning closer in the missile defence field (MD), threatening the security of the region.
					 Recently the BBC said the U.S. and Japan agreed to establish a new missile shield in Japan.
					
					 They insist the new shield is not against China as it is for Japan's warships to defend other regional places. However, analysts expect this agreement will certainly enrage China, the BBC reported.

articles.title: Russian State Duma Denounces European Parliament's Decision
articles.content:
Russian State Duma Denounces European Parliament's Decision
						
 Moscow, September 19 (KCNA) -- Deputies to the Russian State Duma harshly criticized the decision of the European Parliament and its charge that the human right conditions have become worse in Russia recently.
					 The chairman of the International Affairs Committee of the Russian State Duma noted the European Parliament's decision sat loose on the fact and is always hypocritical and amphibious, saying such decision does not affect Russia at all.
					
					 The chairman of the Security Committee said the European Parliament does not respect independent law of relevant country and people and does not observe elementary democratic principle.

articles.title: Strategic Drills Start in Russia
articles.content:
Strategic Drills Start in Russia
 Moscow, September 19 (KCNA) -- Strategic drills codenamed Kavkaz-2012 were kicked off in the Southern Military District of Russia on Monday.
					 8 000 troops, more than 200 military vehicles, about 100 artillery pieces, about 10 warships and other vessels were involved in the drills which will last till Saturday.
					
					 The basic goal of the drills is to improve the practical ability of the commanding officers and the staffs, use promising automated commanding system and adapt the military units to the plain conditions of using high precision and new type weapons.

articles.title: IRGC Warns Enemies against Aggression Moves
articles.content:
IRGC Warns Enemies against Aggression Moves
						
 Tehran, September 19 (KCNA) -- The Iranian commander of the Islamic Revolution Guards Corps (IRGC) at a press conference on Sept. 16 warned the enemies against their aggression moves.
					 The IRGC with modern arms and equipment is fully ready to defend the country, he said, adding if the enemies attack Iran, its armed forces and people will retaliate with missile strike to wipe out all the U.S. military bases in the region and reduce Israel to debris.
					
					 He said that Iran will quit the nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty if the country's nuclear facilities come under attack. In this case, Iran's obligations will change, he added.

articles.title: Japanese Residents' Opposition to Deployment of U.S. Osprey Mounts
articles.content:
Japanese Residents' Opposition to Deployment of U.S. Osprey Mounts 
						
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- Opposition to the deployment of the U.S. forces' transporter Osprey is mounting higher in Okinawa Prefecture, Japan.
					 The chairman of the Federation of Commercial Associations in Okinawa Prefecture recently met the Minister of Defence and handed a resolution demanding the cancellation of the U.S. plan to deploy Osprey adopted at a recent meeting of prefectural residents.
					
					 All the residents are aware that the safety of Osprey fell to the ground due to its repeated accidents, the chairman noted, warning that if planes are deployed, the residents' anger will grow bitterer.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reune con embajador indio
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam se reune con embajador indio
						
Pyongyang, 20 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, departio el dia 20 en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con Pratap Singh, embajador de la Republica de la India, quien le hizo una visita de despedida.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim recorre importantes empresas
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim recorre importantes empresas 
						
Pyongyang, 20 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El premier coreano Choe Yong Rim, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, averiguo en el terreno los Complejos de Abonos de Hungnam y de Vinalon 8 de Febrero.
					Tras recorrer varios puntos de los complejos, Choe convoco las reuniones consultivas.
					
					Se discutieron en las ocasiones los problemas de que los funcionarios y los obreros produzcan gran cantidad de abonos y los suministren a las granjas socialistas.
					
					 Tambien se abordaron las medidas para incrementar la produccion organizando con escrupulosidad el mantenimiento de instalaciones y la administracion tecnica en todos los procesos productivos incluido el proceso de fibras de vinalon y asegurar en las unidades relacionadas las materias primas y materiales necesarios.
					
					Es muy importante la posicion que ocupan los complejos en la construccion de la potencia economica y la mejora de la vida del pueblo, dijo y exhorto a los obreros de los citados complejos a ponerse en la delantera del gran avance de hoy.
					
					Con anterioridad, el premier visito el Complejo Siderurgico Kim Chaek y organizo la reunion consultiva.
					
					En la ocasion se tomaron las medidas para producir innovacion en la produccion de materiales de hierro y acero siguiendo concentrando mayores fuerzas a la modernizacion de los procesos productivos y suministrar ante todo el carbon y la electricidad al Complejo.

articles.title: MINREX se refiere a nueva base de radar a instalarse en Japon
articles.content:
MINREX se refiere a nueva base de radar a instalarse en Japon 
						
Pyongyang, 20 de septiembre (ACNC) -- En relacion con que Estados Unidos publico que instalara la nueva base de radar en Japon acusando a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, el vocero del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de esta respondio el dia 20 a la pregunta de un reportero de la ACNC.
					El secretario de Defensa estadounidense, Panetta tras reunirse el dia 17 en Tokio con su homologo japones, concedio una rueda de prensa conjunta, ocasion en la cual publico que acordo instalar otra base de radar en la zona meridional de Japon para hacer frente a la "amenaza de ataque de misiles del Norte de Corea".
					
					Con anterioridad, se dio a la publicidad el plan de EE.UU. de establecer el sistema antimisiles de Asia instalando nuevas bases de radar en Japon y la region del Noreste Asiatico y conectandolos con otros emplazados en la tierra y el mar.
					
					La instalacion de nueva base de radar en el territorio japones, siendo un eslabon de maniobra del imperio para perfeccionar el sistema regional antimisiles, toma como su blanco a los grandes paises en Eurasia, lo que agravara la situacion regional y promovera la carrera armamentista.
					
					Durante los decenios pasados, el imperio yanqui  ha venido incrementando incesantemente los gastos militares y aumento solamente la codicia de los consorcios militares desviando la opinion publica mediante la predilecta guerra psicologica de estructurar el escudo antimisil contra el ataque de misiles de los latentes enemigos. Ademas vino tratando de establecer por doquier del mundo el sistema de su dominacion militar.
					
					No pasa de ser una ilusion irrealizable interceptar algo con el sistema antimisiles.
					
					Lo que no se puede pasar por alto es que Panetta  hablo abiertamente que la nueva base es no para apuntar a China sino a la RPDC. Cuando las autoridades diplomaticas norteamericanas suelen hablar de que su pais no tiene la voluntad de hostilizar a la RPDC, la autoridad de la capa militar lo nego totalmente y reconocio abiertamente que EE.UU. tiene hostilidad contra la RPDC. 
					
					En la condicion de que el imperio, mayor poseedor de armas nucleares y misiles en el mundo, da mas acicate al incremento de las fuerzas militares apuntando a la RPDC, es muy natural que esta amplie e intensifique sin cesar el disuasivo nuclear.
					
					La actitud del imperio nos demanda convertirnos en el pais poseedor de armas nucleares mas poderosas correspondiente a su "rival".

articles.title: Seminario nacional sobre patriotismo de Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Seminario nacional sobre patriotismo de Kim Jong Il
						
Pyongyang, 20 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 20 en el Palacio Cultural del Pueblo el seminario nacional para estudiar profundamente el patriotismo de Kim Jong Il y materializarlo en la practica.
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes el secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Kim Ki Nam y otros cuadros interesados, asi como los funcionarios del partido, administracion, entidades de masas, las ramas de ciencia, educacion, literatura y arte, prensa e informacion, organos de formacion de funcionarios del partido y lugares de interes historico.
					
					En el seminario se debatieron las tareas para que todos los funcionarios, los militantes del PTC y los trabajadores tomen el patriotismo de Kim Jong Il como su maxima de vida y lucha y aceleren la  construccion de la patria rica y prospera.
					
					Los oradores subrayaron que en toda su vida el Dirigente Kim Jong Il defendio la patria superando las dificultades de toda indole y dedico todo lo suyo para la prosperidad de la Corea de Kim Il Sung.
					
					El mencionado patriotismo resulta la maxima manifestacion del patriotismo socialista porque   Kim Jong Il lo mostro directamente conservando en su alma la patria y al pueblo, recalcaron.
					
					Apuntaron que Kim Jong Il fue el patriota sin par quien con la mas noble y ardiente concepcion de la patria, el pueblo y las generaciones venideras, dedico toda su vida para la prosperidad de la patria y la felicidad eterna de las generaciones venideras.
					
					Se refirieron a que el Mariscal Kim Jong Un encarna en el nivel mas alto el amor a la patria y al pueblo al igual que el Dirigente.
					
					Desde su tierna edad el Mariscal cultivo el verdadero patriotismo, con lo cual ama fervientemente a los arboles y hierbas aunque sea uno, aseveraron.
					
					Acotaron que con la conciencia y responsabilidad de su mision de encargarse del destino la patria y el pueblo legados por el Dirigente Kim Jong Il hace todos sus esfuerzos por el fortalecimiento y la prosperidad de la patria y la felicidad del pueblo.
					
					Avivar mas en todo el pais el fervor del patriotismo de Kim Jong Il y lograr la victoria final de la construccion de la patria prospera, constituyen la obligacion merecida y el sagrado deber de las  generaciones venideras del Presidente Kim Il Sung, los soldados y discipulos del Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					Destacaron que los funcionarios, los militantes del partido y los trabajadores deben materializar cabalmente el patriotismo de Kim Jong Il tomandolo como guia de lucha practica por la construccion de la patria prospera.
